message.content:
cs.PL, cs.DC, cs.AR, cs.SE, cs.LG 

The paper proposes a programming library, SafeGPU, that integrates design-by-contract approach to increase confidence in functional program correctness. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category. The paper also discusses the difficulty of programming GPUs and the need for low-level control of hardware, which suggests that it could also belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a solution for making GPU data-parallel operations accessible from within a classical object-oriented programming language, which could place it in the Architecture (cs.AR) sub-category. The paper also discusses the modularity and maintainability of the code, which suggests that it could belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed library, which could place it in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
